intro: Tinnea gracilis, commonly known as the slender tinnea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with four petals, and appear in clusters. Tinnea gracilis is often found in woodland areas and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
